page.title: 02WARGRAVE & DISTRICT FARMERS
page.content: We interviewed a{farmer}who owns 320 acres, a{tenant farmer,}a{herdsman}& a {smallholder.}The tenant farmer employs 6 men,including a tractor driver and 4 herdsmen, on his medium sized,600 acre farm. One farmer keeps 67 cows and the other has 600. The herdsman we met is responsible for 108 cows and the milk yield is 8500 litres per week. All the workers are skilled and attend courses with the Agricultural Training Board.Both farmers have students from the Berkshire College of Agriculture to learn on their farms. Both farmers agreed the 1984 harvest was the best they had known. They produce grass for silage, forage, maize, barley & spring corn. They own tractors, harrows, drills, milking machines, and machines which do several jobs. The smallholder grows vegetables and fruit for local customers.
